grade_description: No meaningful harness. AI output is essentially unaudited.

checks.name: Architecture Documentation
checks.remediation: Create ARCHITECTURE.md at repo root following matklad's pattern: short, stable, focused on module boundaries and constraints.

checks.name: Agent Instructions
checks.evidence: No AI agent instruction files found
checks.remediation: Create CLAUDE.md or AGENTS.md with project context, code style, and constraints so AI agents produce consistent output.

checks.name: Architecture Decision Records
checks.remediation: Create docs/adr/ directory with numbered markdown decision records. Use adr-tools or a simple template.

checks.name: Module Boundary Documentation
checks.remediation: Document which modules must NOT depend on each other in ARCHITECTURE.md. Example: 'The fields crate never depends on any other workspace crate.'

checks.name: API Documentation
checks.evidence: No API documentation generation or spec files found
checks.remediation: Add doc generation to CI (cargo doc, typedoc, sphinx) or maintain OpenAPI/Swagger specs.

checks.name: Linter Enforcement
checks.remediation: Add a linter to CI that blocks merges on violations (e.g. cargo clippy -- -D warnings, eslint --max-warnings 0).

checks.name: Formatter Enforcement
checks.evidence: No formatter check found in CI
checks.remediation: Add a formatter check to CI (e.g. cargo fmt --all -- --check, prettier --check).

checks.name: Type Safety
checks.remediation: Use a statically typed language, enable TypeScript strict mode, or add mypy/pyright to CI for Python.

checks.name: Dependency Auditing
checks.remediation: Add cargo deny/audit, npm audit, pip-audit, or Snyk to CI as a blocking check.

checks.name: Conventional Commits
checks.remediation: Add commitlint or equivalent to CI to enforce consistent commit message format.

checks.name: Unsafe Code Policy
checks.evidence: No explicit policy against unsafe code patterns
checks.remediation: Add unsafe_code = forbid (Rust), security linting (semgrep/bandit), or ESLint rules against dangerous patterns.

checks.name: Test Suite
checks.evidence: Tests found but not confirmed in CI
checks.remediation: Add test execution to your CI pipeline.
checks.source: Kent Beck - tests define what correct means

checks.name: Feature Matrix Testing
checks.remediation: Add CI jobs for different feature flags, environments, or dependency versions (e.g. --all-features, --no-default-features, MSRV check).

checks.name: Code Coverage
checks.remediation: Add cargo llvm-cov, pytest-cov, istanbul/c8, or equivalent to CI. Even informational coverage provides a feedback loop.

checks.name: Mutation Testing
checks.remediation: Add cargo-mutants (Rust), Stryker (JS/TS), mutmut (Python), or PIT (Java). Mutation testing catches tests that pass without verifying behavior.
checks.source: SlopCodeBench - code that 'appears correct but is unreliable'

checks.name: Property-Based Testing
checks.remediation: Add proptest (Rust), hypothesis (Python), or fast-check (JS/TS) for testing invariants with random structured inputs.
checks.source: Blog: catching edge cases in AI-generated code

checks.name: Fuzz Testing
checks.remediation: Add fuzz targets for parsing-heavy and input-handling code paths.
checks.source: Blog: 80% problem - catching what AI misses

checks.name: Contract / Compatibility Tests
checks.evidence: No contract or compatibility tests found
checks.remediation: Add contract tests that verify external interface stability (golden fixtures, snapshot tests, wire-format checks).

checks.name: Tests Block Merge
checks.evidence: No test jobs found in CI
checks.remediation: Add test execution to CI as a blocking job.

checks.name: Code Review Required
checks.evidence: Cannot verify branch protection without API access. Run with --github-token or --gitlab-token for full assessment.
checks.remediation: Enable required reviews in branch protection settings and add CODEOWNERS.

checks.name: Scheduled CI Jobs
checks.source: OpenAI Harness Engineering - garbage collection agents

checks.name: Stale Documentation Detection
checks.remediation: Add TODO/FIXME scanning, link checking (lychee), or prose linting (vale) to CI.

checks.name: PR/MR Template
checks.remediation: Add .github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md or .gitlab/merge_request_templates/Default.md with sections for description, testing, and impact.

checks.name: Automated Code Review
checks.remediation: Configure CodeRabbit, SonarCloud, Dependabot/Renovate, or equivalent for automated review on every PR/MR.
checks.source: OpenAI Harness Engineering - separate authoring and reviewing agents

checks.name: Documentation Sync Check
checks.evidence: No documentation sync checks found in CI
checks.remediation: Add CI jobs that verify related docs stay in sync (e.g. diff AGENTS.md CLAUDE.md, golden fixture checks).
checks.source: OpenAI Harness Engineering - curated knowledge base

checks.name: AI Usage Norms
checks.remediation: Document AI usage policies: review expectations for AI-generated code, when manual implementation is required, testing-before-implementation norms.
checks.source: DORA 2025 - clear organizational stance on AI use

checks.name: Small Batch Enforcement
checks.remediation: Add PR size checks (Danger, pr-size-labeler) or document size guidelines in CONTRIBUTING.md. Large AI-generated PRs are harder to review.

checks.name: Design-Before-Code Culture
checks.remediation: Create docs/rfcs/ or docs/designs/ directory. Document a process where significant changes start with a design doc or plan before implementation.

checks.name: Error Handling Policy
checks.remediation: Add clippy lints (unwrap_used, expect_used) for Rust, ESLint rules for JS/TS, or document error handling patterns in agent instructions.
checks.source: Blog: AI agents deleting tests, using expect()

checks.name: Security-Critical Path Marking
checks.remediation: Add CODEOWNERS for sensitive directories, SECURITY.md for vuln reporting, or SAST scanning in CI.
